body.p:
State of Tennessee,
EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT.
TO HIS EXCELLENCY, THE GOVERNOR OF Kentucky --

Sir: It has been made known to me that a certain H. H. McManners & Alice Long alias McDonald alias Mc Manner of our County of Shelby -- stands charged with having in the month of January 18561 unlawfully and feloniously break into the the houses of Mssr Stebbens & Pullen and of M Simon and steal and carry away Goods silver ware &c to the amount of Four Thousand, Three hundred dollars as will more fully appear from an authenticated refuge of Affidavit -- herewith transmitted: And whereas, it has been made known to me that the said McManners & Alice Long alias McDonald alias McManner fled from justice and are now running at large in the State of Kentucky

Now Therefore, I, Isham, G. Harris -- Governor of the State of Tennessee, in pursuance of the Act of Congress, entitled "An Act respecting, Fugitives from Justice," do hereby demand that your Excellency will please cause the said McManners & Alice Long alias McDonald alias Mc Manner to be arrested if to be found within the limits of the State over which you preside, and have them safely delivered to I. S. Dyer -- who is appointed Agent on the part of this State to receive the said fugitive from the civil authorities of the State of Kentucky to the end that they may be brought to the State of Tennessee and dealt with according to law.
In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto set my hand and caused the Great Seal of the State to be affixed at NASHVILLE, on the Thirteenth day of March 18561

BY THE GOVERNOR:
Isham G Harris
E Ray Secretary of State.

STATE OF TENNESSEE,
SHELBY COUNTY. } SS.
TO ANY LAWFUL OFFICER OF SAID COUNTY -- GREETING:

WHEREAS, B. RK. Pullen having this day complained on oath to me, that H. H. McManners & Alice Lo alias McDonald alias McManner late of said County, did, on the day of January 1861; in said County, and with the jurisdiction of the Criminal Court of Memphis, unlawfully & feloniously break into the Store House of W A Meier, Chas Stebbins & B. K. Pullen under style of Meier, Stebbins & Pullen & steal take & carry away a lot of Silver Plate & other goods of the value about three Hundred Dollars,^the property of said Meier Stebbins & Pullen^ & did break into the Store House of M Simon & Steal take & carry away a lot of Goods of the value of Four thousand Dollars the property of Said Simon contrary to the Statutes in such cases made & provided & against the peace & dignity of the State

THERE ARE, THEREFORE, to command you to apprehend the said H. H. McManners & Alice Long, Alias, McDonald alias McManners^ if to be found in your County, and bring him before me or some other Justice of the Peace for said County, to answer the premises, and further to be dealt with according to law.
Given under my hand and seal this 11th day of March 1861.
J. Horne J. P. L. S.

Isham G. Harris
Governor of the State of Tennessee:
To all who shall see these Presents, -- Greeting:

It is hereby Certified, That J. Horne -- whose genuine signature appears to the above Certificate, is and was at the time of signing the same, an acting Justice in and for the said county and State duly elected and qualified
And that full faith and credit should be given to his official attestation as such.
In Testimony Whereof I have hereunto set my hand and caused the Great Seal of the State to be affixed at NASHVILLE, in this 13th day of March 1861.

BY THE GOVERNOR:
Isham G Harris

I E R Ray
SECRETARY OF STATE.

Tennessee
Warrant
Issd Mar 14th 1861
H. H. McManners & Alice Long
Felony

STATE OF TENNESSEE
VS. } WARRANT.
H. H. McManners & Alice Long alias McDonald alias McManners
Executed this Warrant on by arresting and bringing before J. HORNE, Esq., for trial.

This day of 186
C. S. C.
